summary: This memo discusses the Information Council of the Americas (INCA) and its Truth Tapes program aimed at combating Communist penetration in Latin America. It details interactions with Edward Scannell Butler, INCA's Executive Vice President, and explores the potential of INCA's correspondence files as a source of information on radio broadcasting stations in Latin America. The memo also seeks input on additional topics for INCA's questionnaire to gather technical information about the stations.
title: Information Council of the Americas (INCA) and Truth Tapes Program
recipient: Chief, Contact Division; Att'n: Nonsov Bloc Area
